headline: Papa John’s Stock Surges on Reported Private Takeover—Again
summary: Papa John’s International  stock shot up by double-digits in Monday trading as another potential acquirer emerged.  The pizza chain might go private under a buyout by a group of investors, led by private-equity company TriArtisan Capital Advisors, ABC Money reported, citing people familiar with the matter.  TriArtisan and Papa John’s didn’t immediately respond to a request for comment.

raw.headline: Papa John’s Stock Surges on Reported Private Takeover—Again

The pizza chain might go private under a buyout by a group of investors, led by private-equity company TriArtisan Capital Advisors, ABC Money reported, citing people familiar with the matter.  TriArtisan and Papa John’s didn’t immediately respond to a request for comment.

headline: Apollo Buys Majority Stake in Soccer Club Atlético de Madrid
summary: Apollo Global Management  agreed to acquire a majority stake in Spanish soccer club Atlético de Madrid, continuing a rush by private-equity firms and other financial backers to invest in European soccer.  The deal values Atlético at about 2.2 billion euros, or $2.5 billion, according to people familiar with the matter.  Apollo Sports Capital, the firm’s sports investment company, will become the club’s controlling shareholder.

headline: Atlético de Madrid to Welcome Apollo Sports Capital as Majority Shareholder
